title: Shop This Season's Best Coats From Nordstrom, Amazon, and More
description: Fashion-lovers know that come winter, their coat is the statement-making piece of their outfits. You could be wearing a cozy sweater or comfy pajamas, but the coat speaks first, and it's important to get it right. When the temperature dips, you want to have a few options at the ready, and these are just a few of the stylish winter coats we like this year. So, what exactly are the styles we'll be wearing this year? Right now, we're into classic trench coats, cozy teddy coats and wool coats, a little fringe moment, and ultrawarm puffer coats for when it really gets cold and you need to pack on the layers. We found great options from luxury brands, as well as more affordable coats from Amazon and Nordstrom. When it comes to coat colors, we gravitate toward neutrals because they're so easy to pair with a variety of outfits, but we're the first to admit that sometimes something bright or eye-catching is fun - we've even included a sunny yellow down jacket in this guide. From long coats to short, cropped styles, kickstart the winter season with your best coat forward and shop our picks for the best winter coats ahead. Related: 10 Wear-Anywhere Cardigans Perfect For Fall
author: Kyley Warren
excerpt: Shop styles from Amazon, Nordstrom, and more.

Fashion-lovers know that come winter, their coat is the statement-making piece of their outfits. You could be wearing a cozy sweater or comfy pajamas, but the coat speaks first, and it's important to get it right. When the temperature dips, you want to have a few options at the ready, and these are just a few of the stylish winter coats we like this year.

So, what exactly are the styles we'll be wearing this year? Right now, we're into classic trench coats, cozy teddy coats and wool coats, a little fringe moment, and ultrawarm puffer coats for when it really gets cold and you need to pack on the layers. We found great options from luxury brands, as well as more affordable coats from Amazon and Nordstrom.

When it comes to coat colors, we gravitate toward neutrals because they're so easy to pair with a variety of outfits, but we're the first to admit that sometimes something bright or eye-catching is fun — we've even included a sunny yellow down jacket in this guide. From long coats to short, cropped styles, kickstart the winter season with your best coat forward and shop our picks for the best winter coats ahead.

Best Trench Coat

Farktop Oversized Long Trench Coat Double Breasted Lapel Windproof Overcoat With Belt ($80)

Long gone are the days of clunky, unflattering, and downright eye-catching (though not necessarily in a good way) raincoats. With this tie belt waistcoat, you can withstand the season's storms in style — and keep your outfit from getting soaked. This trench raincoat is so polished, you'll be reaching for it when commuting to work or heading out for date night.

Best Puffer Coat

Levi's Water Resistant Faux Leather Puffer Jacket ($90, originally $180)

This faux-leather puffer will keep you warm, dry, and of course, stylish this season. It's made of a smooth, faux-leather material and is water-resistant, so you can bear the elements without compromising on the look. Six colors are currently discounted, including two shades of brown, a dark green shade, and more.

Best Down Coat

Orolay Thickened Long Down Jacket ($105, originally $150)

When we think of luxurious down coats, we think of this sunny style from Orolay. We love that it doesn't feel too bulky, while still providing plenty of insulated warmth. It comes in four colors, and is made of water-resistant polyester material that's wind-proof and designed to last. See the full product details in our Orolay jacket review.

Editor Quote: "If you're looking for a practical, stylish, and long-lasting jacket that you can trust will be a wardrobe staple for years to come, you can't go wrong with this Orolay jacket. It's designed with all types of travelers and environments in mind, with a fit that's flattering for all body types. I love that it combines the benefits of a windbreaker, rain coat, and winter jacket all into one multifunctional style, while still boasting a relatively accessible price tag." — Kyley Warren, assistant editor, Shopping

Best Robe Coat

Tahari Maxi Double Face Wool Blend Wrap Coat ($122-$162)

If you've been looking for a sleek robe coat, you need this long Tahari jacket. It boasts a fitted silhouette and has an effortlessly cool double-layered collar and removable belt. What's more, it comes in a variety of different shades, each of which establish a slightly different aesthetic, depending on what you're going for.

Best Wool Coat

Bernardo Belted Wool Blend Longline Coat ($140, originally $240)

A stylish wool coat can instantly elevate your look, even if you're wearing sweats. This one from Bernardo is a flattering option with a tie belt that delivers that cinched in look. The longline coat is made from a wool blend that will keep you warm as the temperatures drop. Plus, it's available in several staple colors.

Best Shearling Coat

Gap Reversible Recycled Vegan Leather Sherpa Jacket ($248)

When you want to feel warm and look pulled-together, reach for a shearling coat. This style is the one we're coveting right now. We like the shearling piping across the front and back — it makes the classic coat look a little more elevated and equestrian. Pair this with jeans and a sweater for an effortlessly stylish look.

Best Leather Coat

Quince Leather Trench Coat ($250)

Leather coats are popping up everywhere right now, and there are so many great silhouettes to choose from outside of the traditional trench style. If you're looking for a longer option with unique detailing, go with this black leather coat from Quince. It's got a vintage look that we love, and features a sleek, tailored structure that's designed to look flattering on a number of body types.

Best Faux-Fur Coat

Lamarque Linnea Faux Fur Jacket ($275)

When you want to bundle up, few things will keep you warmer than faux fur. This jacket is a great choice because it's so easy to throw on, but looks very put together and elegant. It also comes in chocolate, but we love the medium brown shade.

Best Teddy Coat

UGG Gertrude Long Teddy Coat ($268)

Looking for something impossibly cozy and luxe? UGG has just the thing for you. The brand's Gertrude coat is comfortable, easy to style, and oh-so warm. It also comes in regular and extended sizing and looks great with any pair of waterproof boots in your wardrobe.

Best Camel Coat

Anine Bing Dylan Coatt ($900)

If you're looking for a timeless coat and you don't mind splurging, you'll be thrilled with this Anine Bing coat. It has a removable waist belt, so you can tie it up or leave it open — whichever you prefer. It's made of a wool and cashmere blend, so it's super soft and comfortable.

— Additional reporting by India Yaffe

Kyley Warren (she/her) is an award-winning writer, editor, and affiliate strategist with more than four years of experience in the publishing space. She currently works as an assistant editor on PS Shopping and is an expert on all things related to shopping and fashion. She previously worked with Entertainment Tonight as a style commerce writer, and her byline has appeared in publications globally.

India Yaffe was an associate editor on the Shopping team at PS for five years. She focused on curating the best fitness, fashion, beauty, and home products on the market for the PS audience.
